TopicTitle: "You know you messed it up when..." thread

Articles.Content: When about to prepare for capture burn, instead of pressing "," to slow down time warp you press "." and overshoots into the oblivion of space.
When a flag planted next to your munlander suddenly explodes, causing the ship to explode too (happened to me).

When you've fine-tuned a maneuver node for a rendezvous, come out of map mode to turn off the ASAS in order to orient correctly and you can't because you forgot to deploy the solar panels, and your probe core ran out of power.

You finally build the "perfect" Eve lander only to realize your ladder is too short and Kerbals can't jump on Eve (at least not high enough) Then the rescue lander lands 5km away, eventually you discover it never had the delta-v to lift off anyway lol. The population of my new Eve colony is booming......
When your rocket protons(like the crash today/yesterday.)

When your rocket protons(like the crash today/yesterday.)

When you see orange fuel shooting out in liquid form during launch, and when it explodes into toxic orange smoke you think "Hey that color looks familiar! Uh oh."

When, despite hammering the space bar like it's the damn fire button from Galaga, at 10 kilometers in Kerbin's atmo and coming in fast and with no structural failures of any kind, your chutes refuse to deploy.

Still trying to figure that one out...
